'''Sentret''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''オタチ''' ''Otachi'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Furret}} starting at [[level]] 15.

==Biology==
Sentret is a small, furry Pokémon with a big round body, stubby arms, and two small feet. Its fur is light brown, and it has a tail with dark brown stripes that it uses to stand on to see if there is danger nearby. It has long dark brown ears, a white ring on its belly, and white paw pads. While it is capable of standing on its hind legs, it usually moves on all four. Sentret behaves very nervously and cautiously, apparently fearing for its life. It will not sleep alone, and usually sleeps while another of its kind watches for danger. When one sees a predator, it warns the rest in its pack, and they all flee. Sentret can most commonly be found in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grasslands}}.

==In the anime==
[[File:Nebel Plateau Sentret.png|thumb|left|220px|Sentret in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
[[File:Sentret Egg.png|thumb|220px|A Sentret {{pkmn|Egg}} in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
Sentret debuted in ''[[EP133|Tanks a Lot!]]''. A young Sentret and [[Misty's Togepi]] hi-jacked {{TRT}}'s [[Team Rocket's mechas|Arbo-Tank]]. Later, the two were rescued by {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}} with the help of the young Sentret's family.

{{an|Chaz}} used a Sentret to demonstrate {{m|Iron Tail}} to [[Ash's Pikachu]] in ''[[AG013|All Things Bright and Beautifly!]]''.

A Sentret appeared in ''[[XY035|The Forest Champion!]]'', where it, along with a {{p|Patrat}} and {{p|Pachirisu}}, was gathering food only to be scared by an {{p|Ursaring}}. They were saved thanks to the forest champion {{AP|Hawlucha}}.

===Minor appearances===
A Sentret was one of the Pokémon seen at the [[Pokémon Swap Meet]] in ''[[EP146|Tricks of the Trade]]''.

A Sentret was one of the Pokémon stolen by [[Butch]] and [[Cassidy]] in ''[[EP157|The Fortune Hunters]]''.

A Sentret was one of the Pokémon living at [[Temacu]]'s father's lab in ''[[EP198|The Heartbreak of Brock]]''.

A Sentret appeared in ''[[M04|Celebi: The Voice of the Forest]]''.

A Sentret was one of the inhabitants of an oasis just for Pokémon in ''[[EP207|Got Miltank?]]''. It was responsible for scouting the desert around the oasis.

A baby Sentret appeared at [[Mr. Shellby]]'s house in ''[[EP228|Extreme Pokémon!]]''.

A Sentret appeared in ''[[The Legend of Thunder!]]''.

Sentret were among the inhabitants of the [[Dragon Holy Land]] in ''[[EP252|Fangs for Nothin']]'' and ''[[EP253|Great Bowls of Fire!]]''.

Three Sentret appeared in {{an|Misty}}'s flashback in ''[[EP273|Gotta Catch Ya Later!]]''.

Multiple Sentret appeared in ''[[AG011|A Bite to Remember]]''.

A Sentret was used by one of the students of the [[Pokémon Trainers' School]] in ''[[AG015|Gonna Rule The School!]]''.

A group of Sentret, {{p|Furret}}, {{p|Altaria}}, {{p|Shroomish}}, and {{p|Swablu}} helped {{OBP|Pokémon Ranger|Ranger series}} [[Jack Walker]] when he was a young boy in a blizzard, as seen in a flashback in ''[[M09|Pokémon Ranger and the Temple of Sea]]''. Also, at the beginning of the movie, one is shown being saved by [[Solana]] from a forest fire.

Sentret made a cameo appearance in ''[[M10|The Rise of Darkrai]]'', as one of the Pokémon {{mov|Darkrai|Darkrai|10}} hit with a {{m|Dark Void}}.

Multiple Sentret made a cameo appearance in ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]'' and ''[[M12|Arceus and the Jewel of Life]]''.

A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Sentret appeared in ''[[DP146|Dressed for Jess Success!]]'', where it was seen competing in the {{to|Lilypad}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

Multiple Sentret made a brief appearance in ''[[DP176|Coming Full-Festival Circle!]]''.

A Sentret appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]''.

A Sentret appeared in ''[[SS026|Mewtwo — Prologue to Awakening]]''.

A group of Sentret appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]'' at [[Pokémon Hills]].

A Sentret appeared in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]''.

A Sentret appeared in ''[[XY005|A Blustery Santalune Gym Battle!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Sentret appeared in ''[[XY026|A Battle by Any Other Name!]]'', where it was seen participating in the [[Poké Puff Contest]].

A Sentret appeared in ''[[XY073|A Fashionable Battle!]]''.

A Sentret appeared in ''[[PK27|Pikachu and the Pokémon Music Squad]]''.

A Sentret appeared in ''[[XY119|A Full-Strength Battle Surprise!]]''. This Sentret was among a group of Pokémon escaping a forest where [[Team Flare]] were conducting an experiment.

A Sentret appeared in ''[[XY121|Seeing the Forest for the Trees!]]''. It reappeared in a flashback in ''[[XY139|Facing the Needs of the Many!]]'' and ''[[XY140|Till We Compete Again!]]''.

A Trainer's Sentret appeared in ''[[XY125|A League of His Own!]]''.

A wild Sentret appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]'', where it was one of the Pokémon residing at [[Nebel Plateau]].

A Trainer's Sentret appeared in ''[[XY138|The First Day of the Rest of Your Life!]]''.

Three Sentret appeared in ''[[XY140|Till We Compete Again!]]'', with two of them under the ownership of two different Trainers and one of them being wild.

==In the manga==
[[File:Team Rocket Sentret Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Sentret in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Sentret debuted in ''[[PS090|The Legend]]'' where two were seen by a tree standing on their tails when {{adv|Green}} had finished her message to {{adv|Silver}} in Johto.

A Sentret seen as a Pokémon under the ownership of [[Professor Elm]] in ''[[PS092|Who Gives a Hoothoot?]]''.

Later a Sentret is seen at Earl's Pokémon Academy in [[Violet City]] in ''[[PS117|Slugging It Out With Slugma]]''. {{adv|Crystal}} uses it to illustrate the concept of held items, such as Berries, to one of the children. Later in ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]'' the Sentret from Earl's Pokémon Academy was one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]].

Crystal had also captured a Sentret on her way to Professor Oak's Lab in ''[[PS118|Three Cheers for Chikorita]]''.

A Trainer's Sentret appeared in ''[[PS421|Clobbering Claydol]]''.

In ''[[PS442|Out-Odding Oddish]]'', a Sentret appeared in the [[Pokéathlon]].

{{tc|Team Rocket Grunt|Team Rocket}} was shown to own many Sentret in ''[[PS460|All About Arceus IX]]''.

===In the Pocket Monsters HeartGold & SoulSilver Go! Go! Pokéathlon manga===
A Sentret appeared in [[Pocket Monsters HeartGold & SoulSilver Go! Go! Pokéathlon]].

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
A Sentret made an appearance in ''[[PM069|Demanding Tests at the Pokémon School!]]''.

==Trivia==
* Sentret shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Patrat}}. They are both known as the Scout Pokémon.
* Sentret is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 215.

===Origin===
Despite its name, Sentret's behavior and markings are more similar to {{wp|meerkat}}s than {{wp|ferret}}s. It also shares traits with {{wp|Japanese raccoon dog|tanuki}}, {{wp|flying squirrel}}s (more specifically, the {{wp|Japanese giant flying squirrel}}s), and {{wp|sugar glider}}s.

====Name origin====
Sentret is a combination of ''sentry'' and ''{{wp|ferret}}''.

Otachi is a combination of 尾 ''o'' (tail) and 立つ ''tatsu'' (stand) or 鼬 ''itachi'' (weasel).
